name: Derek Shirk
body:
### Welcome
You may  be looking for my profolio and blog. http://derekshirk.com

### Hello
I'm a Creative Director, Designer and Developer. I've launched and sold a business, helped brand environments, managed teams and carefully aligned millions of pixels for both print and screen. I am currently focusing on expanding my software development skills and exploring other creative opportunities.

I've worked on a wide array of projects ranging from environmental brand design to designing and developing mobile-web experiences.

I am a designer and developer and consultant. I currently publish a weekly newsletter MergeLinks which is a weekly email of curated links to articles, resources, freebies and inspiration for web designers and developers. Visit the site to sign-up to receive the weekly email.

I enjoy working on projects that require strategic, visual and technical execution. I’ve worked on a wide array or projects ranging from environmental brand design to designing and developing web and mobile-web experiences. I’ve worked as a creative director, a web developer, designer and even project manager. My most recent experience of selling the company I co-founded in 2009, Brewhouse,  leaves me exploring new opportunities and working towards launching a few new projects this year.

I am currently focusing some of my energy on building a digital product for the WordPress plugin marketplace. The details of which I hope share in more detail soon. I have also been devoting more time to getting out and meeting new people and exploring new business and employment opportunities. If you have an opportunity you want to discuss with me please visit my contact page When I find time to write I try to share my thoughts and experiences on my blog. When I’m not working you can find me spending time with my beautiful wife and embracing the many wonders of Oregon, most notably the coast and mountains.

### Development Stack
While I try to maintain a general level understanding of as many languages, frameworks and toolsets out there. I most typically with my preferred suite of tools. A lot of the work I do is built on top of WordPress so it is written in PHP. Well versed in git and modern development workflows and team oriented development
